title: Touching way dog to be put down at 4.30pm made the best of last hours alive
text:

A heartbroken dog owner made the most of her dog's final hours as they took one last walk before the beloved pet was set to put down.

Alison French, 57, appealed for people to join her on her last walk with her Shih Tzu Looby on Wallasey Beach, Merseyside, at 1pm today.

Dozens of kindhearted strangers supported Alison as they embarked on the pooch's final stroll together, the Liverpool Echo reported .

Looby, 14, was diagnosed with Lymphoma almost three years ago and was only expected to live for a matter of weeks.

(Image: Geoff Davies)

(Image: Geoff Davies)

Little Looby's longevity stunned medical professionals - but sadly today marked the end of her battle with the condition and will be put to sleep at 4.30pm.

Alison, from Birkenhead, said: "I'm disabled and I've had Looby since she was a puppy, I've never had to face anything like this before.

"I don't really have anyone to support me, so I posted on a few local groups to see if anyone could help me say goodbye to Looby.

"And the response was fantastic, hundreds of people have shared the post and said they would come down to the beach.

"I never thought so many people would reply and send comments."

(Image: Geoff Davies)

Alison regularly takes Looby for walks on the beach and thedog is known for wearing her distinctive pink coat.

Alison continued: "I've met lots of people walking Looby on the beach and have told them all about her condition.

"I wanted to give other people the chance to say goodbye to her as well, so put the post online for them to know about.

"The vet thought she would only last a few weeks, but she's done amazing, I've known other people with dogs with the same condition and they've lost them very quickly, so I've been lucky."

As well as Looby Alison has another dog Lola, a cat called Luna and a kitten called Isla.

(Image: Geoff Davies)

And Alison was thrilled as around 30 people turned out to help support her while she said her final goodbye.

She said: "This is what I wanted, I just wanted people to say their goodbyes to her.

"It's been absolutely beautiful and fantastic to see all these people come out for her and to support me as well, giving me hugs and kisses and crying and it will help me through the day, I know it will.

"I just didn't want to do it by myself at home."
description: Alison French, 57, and her shitzu Looby were joined by 30 kindhearted strangers as they went for a final walk at Wallasey Beach, Merseyside
